comments.body: thats too op

Does it only lead you to one vein of Ancient Debris? If it does, what happens next? Does it shatter? If it does, this might be a pretty balanced idea! Also, you said it’s hard to find, but where do you find it? Maybe it could be a 8% chance of being in a Piglin loot chest?
If it shatters after being near ancient debris (like 2-3 blocks), then this is a very good idea.
It should be way slower than zeroticking though, not 2/3
396585674471 thanks, probably right. edited post
It would be better to make it like the glistening melon, where you craft it.
It could give Absorption, providing extra hearts for a duration. I like randomly getting them from farming.
This is what im looking for for my nightclub on mcpe 1.16 but impossible to find.
New items do not belong in the snapshot category, moved and adjusted title. Thanks.

The luck & unluck should be fixed to work on chests.
Currently it only works on fishing.

You should get unluck from black cats. And luck from dropping a emerald, diamond or gold ingot into a desert well
They should add clover fields in the plains where there’s a small chance off finding a 4leaf that can be used for luck potions ;)
Buttons are not re position
I think that war horn would be enough. And I think that it shouldn't be a craftable item. It could come from loot instead
you could also have woad to use in the recipe
and maybe you could also be able to draw it or have ready made patterns for different cultures such as vikings, celts/gaels etc and the same for war horns like the carynx

I think it should be either this, or the "respawn anchor" should be renamed/have an advancement that implies you can only use it in the Nether. Unlike beds, there is no intuitive reason why a "respawn anchor" would not work in the overworld.

Sorry, I disagree. They even say it is an intentional game mechanic. Setting spawn point in different dimensions should be unique to that dimension. The End should have its own unique spawn point block if they ever do add one.
Javeloz why? Is there a actual reason other than, 'they said so'? Making dimension locked features without a specific reason is a bad rabbit hole to go down.
If you set spawn in the end you can't...ever....leave.
Player died by [Intentional Game Design].
ProPork3455, *bad game design
BraveAxe26 The reapawn anchor needs to be charged, probably so that you don't live outside of the overworld permanently
The diamond coat idea wasn't mine I saw it in an Instagram post and thought it as an interesting idea

Agree with you on the last point but diamonds being the most desirable material in minecraft is so iconic that I think it should still be the material that the best gear is made of. So I'm against the idea of pure netherite stuff but like the compromise of upgrading diamond stuff with it.

The ore should be found in a rare variant of the soul sand valleys as rare as the jungle. the ore is mineable with a netherite pick. The ore is pure netherite ore. The rare variant of the soul sand valley is called the the firey soul sand valley. it's soul fire patches are huge and tons of wither skeletons spawn there. The ore is as rare as ancient debris.
No new models of current netherite gear please I like the current look this should have the same look but brownish.
I agree... If you think about it, why isnt it already there? Oh and where is netherite horse armor?

No 1 REDSTONE,but 1 STONE
It's a good idea man!
But maybe only if you're in it for like, say 10 minutes you would lose 3 hearts worth, really good idea!!
It happening in real life doesn't make it enjoyable or make it add to gameplay, leather armor is already bad enough for me not to use it personally.
Don’t you dye the leather in water?
Maybe not wolf armor, since they are made of armadillo scutes.
The problem with this is that it invalidates evokers
I had the same idea!
No. Pointless. Raids are easy to win with diamond armor over and over. I would rather get 5 totems from 1 raid than spend hours getting ore to craft 1 totem
Needs more uses.
To be honest, I think this is a great idea. But what would you do with the whole block if you used silk touch on it?
Silk touch blocks would work the same as it does with diamond, coal, red stone, and lapis.
Honestly such a no-brainer. It makes perfect sense!

Strongly agree. I think debris, gold and iron ores drop pieces of ore that could be smelted into netherite scraps and gold/iron ingots. Fortune increases this. 4 gravel also should be made into a cobble. Any overworld ore would drop 2-4 gravel as well. Lapis and redstone would drop as it does right now and diamonds/emeralds would drop uncut gems that need to be cut. Coal could drop 2-4 pieces + 1 per level of fortune. The ores could be found in a stone block tagged with an ore tag. Placing an ore item from creative could put it on the block. It would drop 2-4 gravel of the stone type along with the ore item, which could be cobbled.
Not only for Fortune, but also to avoid inventory clutter as they add new ore blocks for different types of stone (Looking at you deep slate ores).
Moved to proper category.
Vegetarians?
Great Idea!

Real life dragonfruits dont really exist in a place where you find lava around every corner, they come from cacti, so if dragonfruits WERE added, they would be added with a new cactus in the badlands/desert.
There isn't any real use in adding this. Consistency is nice, but without any other use, the suggestion isn't very strong.
no

I think if Soulphire was stronger than diamond it could still work since it's stated, " can only be made for weapons ", to me this means weapons only and not stuff like pickaxes and shovles , and lets be honest we need more reasons to go to the nether. And yes I am aware of the nether update coming, however it seems to be more exploration than actually being usefull like "TheRestone 28" , is trying to do.

But from his ore and the mineral I leave them to mojang.
To make up for the high damage, the soul tools should be unenchantable.

I like the trail enchantment, but maybe only the player who left it can see it to avoid servers being too crowded with footsteps. Also, in case you didn’t know, compasses in minecraft point towards your spawn so you can use them for now!
i mean, theres nothin' like an upside down fireplace!
It's odd that they made the sides of wood plank blocks ignitable but not the sides of netherrack.
Yes

Also soul sand and soul soul. I have been thinking about this since 2012. I think I have a notepad somewhere with a bunch of ideas I wanted to see in minecraft and they have added almost every one, except that lol. But think about the aesthetic potential of a fully lit piece of netherrack or soul sand in a brazier, or on a post to light your way.
Or health boost, since there's no way to get it in survival yet?
Goos idea!

I like this idea but I think that you should also be able to use music disks on the flute. When you hold the flute in your off hand a menu that’s similar to the enchanting menu. The player would have to put the music disk in one slot then they’d have to select who the effect would be for, surroundings mobs 5 block radius or themselves, after that they have three options each option costs a different amount of exp the first is 5 the second is 10 and the third is 15. Each music disk has a different set of effects. Once the player is done they select charm the flute will then play the music disk for five seconds for the effect to work. I feel like the flute should have a gem that slowly looses its color the more you use the flute. This would work as the flutes durability (also when a music disk is in the flute the gem is the same color as the center of the disk).
I don't think that is really needed but great idea

this would be useful cuz say like your diamond pic broke right? then u can use this remote to give yourself anew one! or u could summon the wither with it! much simpler than going all the way back to your command block!

I believe this would be great!

hmm. you can hear rain and thunder from quite a way down/through walls. So if you hear rain when you are near/nearing the surface, then it is raining. If you can't, then it is not. Cool idea, but only useful in deep caves, underwater or underground bases.
Vote this to get it implemented.

I feel like this takes away from Minecraft's family friendliness, and it is quite disgusting! Good idea, I just feel it doesn't fit well with Minecraft.
